qas.question: What is the only state in India in which Carnival is celebrated?
What does the Indian word "Intruz" mean?
The largest Carnival celebration takes place in which city?
What is eaten on Fat Tuesday to partake in the celebration?
What legendary king eventually takes over the state?

context: In India, Carnival is celebrated only in the state of <a0_0>Goa<a0_0/> and a Roman Catholic tradition, where it is known as Intruz which means <a1_0>swindler<a1_0/> while Entrudo, the appropriate word in Portuguese for Carnival. The largest celebration takes place in the city of <a2_0>Panjim<a2_0/> which was part of Velha Conquista, Goa, but now is celebrate throughout the state. The tradition was introduced by the Portuguese who ruled Goa for over four centuries. On Tuesday preceding Ash Wednesday, the European Tradition of Fat Tuesday is celebrated with the partaking of eating of <a3_0>crepes<a3_0/> also called as "AleBelle." The crepes are filled with freshly grated coconut and heat condensed coconut sap that sequentially converts it into a brown sweet molasses and additional heat concentration solidifies it to jaggery. The celebrations of Carnival peak for three days and nights and precede Ash Wednesday. When the legendary King <a4_0>Momo<a4_0/> takes over the state. All-night parades occur throughout the state with bands, dances and floats and grand balls are held in the evenings.
